historicEventInformations.remarks: date in the block removed; with verse by Johann Stigel and dated '1554'
Date in the block removed; verse by Johann Stigel and dated '1556'
Date removed from the block; text to the right and dated '1556'

items.description:
Cranach depicts St Christopher here in a mountainous landscape with a broad river that creates great pictorial depth. His face clearly expresses the extreme effort required to transport the infant Christ across the river. A hermit stands with a lantern on the shore in the right background. The electoral coats of arms suspended from the boughs at the upper left suggest that the woodcut was commissioned by Friedrich III the Wise.
The block was initially dated 1506, cut in the line block, but this date was later removed, corresponding with the second state. Competition between Cranach and his contemporaries led to the development of the chiaroscuro woodcut, a tonal block, which simulated heightening by leaving parts of the paper white and it may have prompted him to deliberately antedate the first state by two years. Certain other arguments also cast doubt on the date. Cranach was not entitled to use the coat of arms with a serpent, seen on this print, until 1508 when it was granted to him by Duke Friedrich and in fact, it is not displayed on any other print before 1509. The most likely sequence of events was that Cranach learnt of the advances made in Augsburg on the invention of the tone block soon after his return from the Netherlands in 1508, and then produced his own version in the 'St Christopher' and 'Venus' woodcuts around 1509.

1st state [Dodgson 1911, 295-296, 61a-c] [Hollstein 56.79]:
a. with the date 1506. Chiaroscuro woodcut printed from two blocks, in red-brown
b. as above. Outline block only.

2nd state [Hollstein 56.79]:
a. the date below the serpent removed. Outline block only. At top: 'AdImaginem Divi/ Christophori.'; below: 'In Imaginem Divi Christophori' and 26 verses by Johann Stigel in two columns 1554
b. as a. but with the date 1556
c. with 86 lines letterpress to the right and the date 1556
d. with the date 1560 [Schuchardt 1870, 224]
e. the date removed. Chiaroscuro, printed in both orange-brown and slate grey.

According to [Geisberg 1930, 594]: I. the light reflex on the knee is white; II. the light reflex on the knee has a line in the centre
items.signature:
Artist's insignia in the block, top left on a plaque hanging from the tree: 'LC', winged serpent (with elevated wings) and dated '1506' (inverted five), 1st state

later date removed, 2nd state

titles.title: The Agony in the Garden (from the Passion Christi, series of 14 woodcuts)

historicEventInformations.remarks: 'Kurze und einfältige Auslegung der Episteln und Evangelien, so auf die Sonntage und vornehmsten Feste durch das ganze Jahr gelesen werden', Antonius Corvinus, Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+C+5350]

Passio D.N. Iesv Christi Venvstissimis Imaginibvs Eleganter Expressa ab, Luca Cranogio Anno. 1509., Visscherius, Amsterdam; On the title-page part of 'The Celestial Ladder of St Bonaventura' (H078a). The Lamentation is missing in this edition. All blocks have cracks and broken lines.
Passio D. N. Jesu Christi, venustissimis imaginibus eleganter expressa ab illustrissimi Saxoniae ducis Luca Cranagio Anno 1509. Wittenberg

items.description:
The Agony in the Garden from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; The Flagellation, The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]

historicEventInformations.remarks: 'Kurze und einfältige Auslegung der Episteln und Evangelien, so auf die Sonntage und vornehmsten Feste durch das ganze Jahr gelesen werden', Antonius Corvinus, Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+C+5354; accessed 11-07-2019]

'Kurze und einfältige Auslegung der Episteln und Evangelien, so auf die Sonntage und vornehmsten Feste durch das ganze Jahr gelesen werden', Antonius Corvinus, Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+C+5350; accessed 11-07-2019]

items.description:
The Lamentation from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; The Flagellation, The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]

items.description:
The Resurrection from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated. This image as well as The Flagellation and The Crucifixion are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]
items.signature: Artist's insignia in the block on the wall at the right: serpent (with elevated wings)
